intro: Leptomeria drupacea, commonly known as the red sandstone cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its succulent stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its rugged appearance. Leptomeria drupacea is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its unique morphology and resilience make it a notable species in its ecological niche.
